oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Factors Affecting the Profitability of Organic Farms
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fowler, Sue
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Whole farm data of 26 farms (1995/96 and 1996/97) and some enterprise gross margin data (including some 1997/98 data) for organic farms of six different types (arable, mixed, dairy, lowland sheep and cattle, upland sheep and cattle, horticulture) were analysed. Using Occupiers Net Income per hectare as a measure of profitability, the effects of a range of variables are described. Research recommendations for the MAFF R&D programme were identified
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fowler, Sue (1999) Factors Affecting the Profitability of Organic Farms. Elm Farm Research Centre Bulletin. (46).
